intro: Erythranthe discolor, commonly known as the pale evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Erythranthe discolor is known for its ability to attract nocturnal pollinators such as moths.
